fullText: Ms. Margulies has created characters who register as genuine people, not just pegs on which to hang a thesis. And she has found a theatrical language that accommodates both the mundane and the mythic aspects of her story.
dtliExcerpt: Ms. Margulies has created characters who register as genuine people, not just pegs on which to hang a thesis. And she has found a theatrical language that accommodates both the mundane and the mythic aspects of her story.
bwwExcerpt: Without Ms. Murphy this well-meaning Roundabout Theater Company production - which has a book and lyrics by Iris Rainer Dart and songs by Mike Stoller and Artie Butler - would be thin treacle indeed. As it is, even Ms. Murphy (who also gets to portray the various characters that Raisel plays onstage and on screen) has trouble generating the kind of energy that makes an audience sit up and smile, or sit up, period.
